title: No charges in Michigan City girl's accidental shooting
content:
MICHIGAN CITY — No charges will be filed for a 12-year-old Michigan City girl being wounded in a shooting ruled accidental.
To the best of his knowledge, Swistek said, the girl was still hospitalized with a single gunshot wound after being shot Monday night inside a residence close to Marquette High School.
Swistek did not reveal the exact nature of the girl's injuries but said the injuries were non-life threatening and she was conscious and talking to emergency responders.
''She is expected to survive,'' he said.
Police are also not disclosing a detailed account of what happened Monday, but the girl was with another 12-year-old female inside a home at 1107 Wabash St. when officers responded close to midnight, police said.
Also in the home was the victim's 54-year-old grandmother.
Swistek said the woman was upstairs while the girls were downstairs and the gun was being played with and went off.
